action.action-desc: Ms. Letlow introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To improve drought related disaster assistance programs of the Department of Agriculture, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Drought Assistance Improvement Act.
Section 1501(c)(3)(D)(ii)(I) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(c)(3)(D)(ii)(I)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking at least 8 consecutive and inserting the following:

item.text: 4 consecutive weeks during the normal grazing period for the county, as determined by the Secretary, shall be eligible to receive assistance under this paragraph in an amount equal to 1 monthly payment using the monthly payment rate determined under subparagraph (B); or

paragraph.text: in item (bb) (as so designated), by striking 1 monthly payment and inserting 2 monthly payments.

section.header: Emergency assistance for livestock, honey bees, and farm-raised fish program

subsection.text: Section 1501(d) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting drought, after adverse weather,;
in paragraph (2), by inserting adverse weather or drought, after disease,; and
by adding at the end the following:
For purposes of this subsection, the Secretary, in consultation with eligible producers of farm-raised fish, shall establish a documentation standard for each of the following:

subparagraph.text: Production of crawfish, as related to reductions in harvest.
Defining loss conditions due to drought.

subsection.text: Subsection 1501(d)(2) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(d)(2)) is further amended by inserting and loss of crawfish harvest due to adverse weather or drought after cattle tick fever.
